intro: Trichopilia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian flame flower, is a striking tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Trichopilia peruviana is valued not only for its ornamental qualities but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
